definition: compared with
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: On the whole, average weekly hours are far below their pre-recession level.
sentences.chinese: 整体而言，周平均工作时间比起衰退前大幅下滑。

sentences.english: More folks are killed by dwi than guns.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，比起枪击更多的人可是死于醉驾的。

sentences.english: Nani's passage to the World Cup with Portugal was plain sailing by comparison with Evra's exertions.
sentences.chinese: 纳尼进入世界杯比起埃弗拉来讲就顺理成章的多。

sentences.english: However, it's more polite than a direct request.
sentences.chinese: 但是，比起直接的询问，这是一种更为礼貌的请求。

sentences.english: Football officiating is so subjective - much more subjective than any other sport.
sentences.chinese: 足球的判罚是如此的主观，比起其他运动要主观的多。

sentences.english: Considering the losses in the disaster area, our support was an utterly inadequate measure.
sentences.chinese: 比起灾区的损失，我们的支援不过杯水车薪。

sentences.english: This probably can save the owner a lot of money instead of applying one-off colouring.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为比起一次性染色倒是可以给主人省下很多钱。

sentences.english: Feng cares less about himself than the young people of his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 比起同乡的年轻人，峰更少关心他自己。

sentences.english: Next to them, we can only hang our head in shame over our own capacity to adapt.
sentences.chinese: 比起它们，人类对于自己的适应能力只能是自愧不如。

sentences.english: For my purposes, these are heavier duty than I need.
sentences.chinese: 比起我的目的来说，这些责任比我需要的更大。

sentences.english: This is smaller than the share of the UK in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 这比起在全球经济中英联邦所占的份额来还要少一些。

sentences.english: Adrian:Check anyway. I prefer charter flights to commercial ones.
sentences.chinese: 好好查查吧，比起商务舱，我还是偏好包租的座位。

sentences.english: I terms of speed, the team was better than against Samp and Siena.
sentences.chinese: 速度上，比起桑普和锡耶纳的比赛已经有了进步。

sentences.english: At 19, he looked like a senior citizen compared with the ingénu that was Theo Walcott.
sentences.chinese: 19岁的他，比起年轻的沃尔科特来，就像个老头。

sentences.english: At first, Lee-Hom preferred the violin to the piano.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始比起钢琴力宏更喜欢小提琴。

sentences.english: Those sectors are much more capital intensive than software.
sentences.chinese: 那些领域比起软件业更加重视资本集中。

definition: to compare
unlike
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
comparable
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
to be on good terms/to be close friends/striving for self-improvement
though/although
not to be inferior in any aspects (idiom)/to surpass/to outdo/(derog.) to be even worse
pinyin: you3 guo4 zhi1 er2 wu2 bu4 ji2

definition: even more
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
to appear to be/to seem as if
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
to excel/to surpass
really/indeed
admittedly (it's true that...)
